    "name": "Primes of the form (4n^2+4n-5)/5.",
    "comment": [
        "The n that generate integers of the form (4n^2+4n-5)/5 are in A047208. The primes are generated by the subset n = 5, 9, 14, 15, 24, 30, ... of these. - _R. J. Mathar_, Jan 25 2009"
    ],
    "link": [
        "Vincenzo Librandi, <a href=\"/A154619/b154619.txt\">Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000</a>"
    ],
    "maple": [
        "a := proc (n) if type((4/5)*n^2+(4/5)*n-1, integer) = true and isprime((4/5)*n^2+(4/5)*n-1) = true then (4/5)*n^2+(4/5)*n-1 else end if end proc: seq(a(n), n = 1 .. 340); [From _Emeric Deutsch_, Jan 21 2009]"
    ],
    "mathematica": [
        "Select[Table[(4n^2+4n-5)/5,{n,3,200}],PrimeQ] (* _Vincenzo Librandi_, Jul 23 2012 *)"
    ],
    "xref": [
        "Cf. A028880."
    ],
    "keyword": "nonn,easy",
    "offset": "1,1",

        "Definition corrected and more terms from R. J. Mathar and Omar E. Pol, Jan 24 2009",
